page.title: 07SCAMBLESBY-GOULCEBY/COUNCILS
page.content:
The lowest tier of Local Government is the Parish Council. { Scamblesby}Parish Council has seven Councillors and meets approximately six to eight times per year. { Goulceby}has a joint Council with {Asterby.
The Parish Council has many wide-ranging powers,but very few statutary duties.Its main functions are to discuss,and perhaps resolve, local issues;comment on planning applications,and to express the views of the Parish on the plans and policies of other public agencies which affect the area(e.g. schools).
Representatives to all the Local Councils are elected every four years.
